story.title: Marcus and the Apocalypse - Episode 4
story.storyDescription: When a nuclear weapon hits Manhattan, Marcus escapes. But can he survive in the violent, chaotic, refugee-glutted suburbs?
story.creator: web-uploader

author.bio: Emmy Laybourne is the author of the Monument 14 trilogy, which tells the story of fourteen kids trapped in a superstore while civilization collapses. Her new series, Berserker, is about a family of Norwegian teenagers with ancient Viking superpowers.

story.prePaywallNotification: Can Marcus and his friends escape the crazed bomb survivors? Read more of MARCUS AND THE APOCALYPSE.
story.postPaywallNotification: Who is shooting at the four teens?!! Keep reading MARCUS AND THE APOCALYPSE.

messages.text: Marcus and his friends walk through the woods for hours.
Shawn insists on walking a bit behind the group.
He says he’s just keeping an eye out for bomb survivors…
But his behavior gets more and more paranoid as the day goes on.
Marcus falls back to talk to him.
Hey man, how’s it going?
Fine.
You want a Hershey bar?
Yeah, okay.
Marcus hands Shawn the bar.
Shawn gobbles it down.
You feeling okay?
I just want to be alone.
Well, I’m here if you, whatever, want to talk…
Marcus goes back up to where Gabi and Luke are walking.
Is he okay?
Not really. Wouldn’t talk to me or anything.
Maybe he’s in shock.
I mean, his dad works in midtown.
Maybe he’s just sad.
Could be.
No word yet from your mom, huh?
No. But I’m glad that your folks made it out of the city all right.
God, so am I. Ever since I got their text last night, I feel like I can breathe again.
Hey! There’s a sound!
What?
Like a motorcycle. Coming from that way.
Shawn points slightly ahead of them, to the north.
I don’t hear anything. You sure?
I thought…
They all pause, but they don’t hear anything.
Never mind.
Paranoid, much?
Don’t be mean. It’s good he’s paying attention. We all should be.
Whatever. Ugh.
How long ‘til we get to Scranton, anyway?
My uncle’s gonna meet up with us in Stroudsburg.
It’s right across the state line in Pennsylvania.
You didn’t even answer my question.
Because I don’t know, exactly.
I’m thirsty. Can I have another bottle of water?
No, Luke. I told you.
We each get one bottle in the morning and one in the afternoon.
But I drank mine.
He told you to sip it.
We have to make our water last for another day and a night!
I’m bigger than y’all. I need more water. Please?
You are wearing me out, Luke. I mean, really.
Well, when those zombies catch up with us, you’re gonna be happy to have me around.
Luke flashes the gun at her.
If we’re lucky, they won’t ever catch up with us.
Suddenly BAM! They hear a shot from behind a tree.
Luke stumbles to the ground. He drops the gun, clutching his leg.
A man comes out from behind a tree holding a handgun.
His eyes are crazed, and his lips are stained black.
All of you down!
Take it easy!
Don’t shoot! We’re just kids!
Marcus and Gabi get down on the dead leaves and dirt of the forest ground.
Marcus looks around, but he can’t see Shawn anywhere.
The man stalks over to Luke and kicks the gun out of his reach, then picks it up.
I want your bags. Your water and food.
Please, mister. We need them.
Shut up!
He grabs the kids’ backpacks.
With one hand, he rummages through Marcus’ backpack.
He finds a bottle of water and drinks it down, desperately thirsty.
He wipes the back of his hand and goes for another bottle.
There’s a shout and Shawn runs out from behind a tree, tackling the man.
He knocks him over and the man’s head cracks into a tree branch.
He falls to the ground.
Shawn grabs the handgun and starts pounding the man on the head with it.
My water! Mine!
Shawn! It’s okay.
Easy, Shawn! You’re killing him!
Shawn looks up at them.
His mouth is black inside.
It’s not as black as the other man’s, but decidedly dark.
Shawn, you’re…
You’re infected.
But how…oh my God — the hat!
Shawn is still wearing the hat he took from the paramedic.
Remember that dust we saw in the cabin of the ambulance?
It was all over everything.
It must have contaminated the hat.
Shawn picks up the backpacks.
He starts dragging them from the direction that the man appeared.
Stay away.
You can’t take those, Shawn. We need them…
Luke groans. Gabi goes to his side.
He’s bleeding, Marcus! I need the bandages.
Shawn! I need my backpack!
Marcus follows Shawn off into the woods a few paces.
They both see a single-rider ATV parked off across a meadow.
The man must have been riding it.
Mine!
You can have it, Shawn, but we need our bags.
Stay away from me.
Luke is hurt! I got bandages in there. Come on!
Mine.
Shawn raises the man’s handgun at Marcus!
He’s going to shoot him…
A shot echoes through the woods—
And Shawn falls.
Marcus turns to see Gabi standing behind him, smoke rising from Luke’s gun.
We need that ATV.
